intro: Mitragyna africana, commonly known as African kratom, is a tropical evergreen tree native to western and central Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant produces small, red or black berries that contain the seeds. It is valued for its psychoactive properties and has been used traditionally for its stimulant and analgesic effects. Due to its potential medicinal uses, it is also of interest in pharmacological research.
